fast3d.complex.light

Class Material

  • java.lang.Object
    • fast3d.complex.light.Material

  • public class Material
extends java.lang.Object
    combines all data used to render under light
    Author:
    Tim Trense

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      double alpha
      the alpha-component of the colors is not respected due to illumination has to be on solid surfaces - this alpha is applied to the visible color as result of the lighting-calculation
      opaque is 1d, transparent is 0d
      Color ambient
      the color used to illuminate with ambient light (background-light)
      Color diffuse
      the color used to illuminate with diffuse light (directional/point-light)
      Color emissive
      the color that is visible at minimum even if no light source shines to the surfaces with this material
      double shininess
      the factor how wide the shine-dot of the shine-light is
      Color specular
      the color used to illuminate with specular light (shine-light)
      Texture texture
      if not null an AdvTriangle has a lighted texture on it

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Material()
      all colors will be white, shininess=1, alpha=1, no texture
      Material(Color ambient, Color diffuse, Color specular, Color emissive, double shininess)
      initiates the materials data, opaque, no texture
      Material(Color ambient, Color diffuse, Color specular, Color emissive, double shininess, double alpha)
      initiates the materials data, no texture
      Material(Color ambient, Color diffuse, Color specular, Color emissive, double shininess, double alpha, Texture texture)
      initiates the materials data
      Material(Color ambient, Color diffuse, Color specular, Color emissive, double shininess, Texture texture)
      initiates the materials data

      • ambient

        public final Color ambient
        the color used to illuminate with ambient light (background-light)

      • diffuse

        the color used to illuminate with diffuse light (directional/point-light)

      • specular

        public final Color specular
        the color used to illuminate with specular light (shine-light)

      • shininess

        public double shininess
        the factor how wide the shine-dot of the shine-light is

      • emissive

        public final Color emissive
        the color that is visible at minimum even if no light source shines to the surfaces with this material

      • alpha

        public double alpha
        the alpha-component of the colors is not respected due to illumination has to be on solid surfaces - this alpha is applied to the visible color as result of the lighting-calculation
        opaque is 1d, transparent is 0d

      • texture

        public Texture texture
        if not null an AdvTriangle has a lighted texture on it
